meanings.sent1: The exodus of students from the school after the final bell rang was chaotic.
meanings.sent2: The exodus of birds flying south for the winter was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent3: The exodus of ants from the picnic basket left the family surprised and amused.
meanings.sent4: The exodus of shoppers from the store on Black Friday resembled a stampede.
meanings.sent5: The exodus of passengers from the train station was like a river flowing out of a dam.

meanings.definition: A going out; a departure or emigration, usually of a large number of people.
meanings.sent1: The sudden exodus of bees from the hive puzzled the beekeeper.
meanings.sent2: The exodus of settlers from the town was due to the harsh winter conditions.
meanings.sent3: The exodus of cookies from the jar seemed like a magic trick to the children.
meanings.sent4: The exodus of stars from the sky at dawn signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The exodus of cars from the parking lot created a traffic jam on the street.
